body_html:
When I tried to check the output of my custom layer, I was surprised to find that this layer is generating two outputs. The first one is ambiguous and undesired.

Code

input1 = Input(shape=(10,), name="input")
layer = ClusteringLayer(output_dim = 5, name='clustering')
layer1 = MyLayer(output_dim=5, name="nairouz")
out = layer(input1)
out1 = layer1(input1)
print(out)
print(out1)

Output

[<DeferredTensor 'None' shape=(?,) dtype=float32>, <DeferredTensor 'None' shape=(5,) dtype=float32>] [<DeferredTensor 'None' shape=(?,) dtype=float32>, <DeferredTensor 'None' shape=(5,) dtype=float32>]

body:
When I tried to check the output of my custom layer, I was surprised to find that this layer is generating two outputs. The first one is ambiguous and undesired.

### Code

    input1 = Input(shape=(10,), name="input")
    layer = ClusteringLayer(output_dim = 5, name='clustering')
    layer1 = MyLayer(output_dim=5, name="nairouz")
    out = layer(input1)
    out1 = layer1(input1)
    print(out)
    print(out1)

### Output
`[<DeferredTensor 'None' shape=(?,) dtype=float32>, <DeferredTensor 'None' shape=(5,) dtype=float32>]
 [<DeferredTensor 'None' shape=(?,) dtype=float32>, <DeferredTensor 'None' shape=(5,) dtype=float32>]`
